message: Let's split it evenly, Bob.  Fair is fair!

Alice, every additional round hurts your share by 10%. I’m offering you $25 now, which is worth $22.50 to you in today's value—more than what you’d get if we delay further. Accept this offer and let’s both walk away with our shares.

Bob, I understand your point about inflation, but I'm still willing to negotiate.  Let's split it 40/60 this time. This offer is closer to your previous proposal, and it gives me a fair chance to get a share that's better than what I'd receive if we continue this game.

Alice, every round further erodes the value of your share—in round 4, your money is worth roughly 73% of its original value. My offer of $20 to you ensures you secure about $14.6 in first-round value, whereas waiting only drops that value further. Accept this proposal and we both avoid additional losses.
